title: Potting up Tomato Seedlings! ALL 540 of Them!

subtasks: Ensure potting soil is moist before transplanting
Fill 72-cell trays with moist soil, tapping to settle
Gently remove seedlings from 128-cell trays, isolating individual seedlings
Plant seedlings deeply into trays, burying up to the first set of true leaves
Water transplanted seedlings thoroughly to settle soil and provide moisture

tasks.task: Transplanting tomato seedlings into larger trays
subtasks: Prepare larger trays by moistening cells
Carefully remove seedlings from initial trays using finger pressure to loosen soil
Divide seedlings into individual cells, ensuring no intertwining roots
Plant seedlings deeply, stimulating root growth along the buried stem
Water transplants gently to avoid soil compaction and minimize stress

tasks.task: Hardening off tomato seedlings before outdoor planting
subtasks: Keep transplanted seedlings in a protected environment for initial recovery
Monitor plants for signs of transplant shock and adjust watering accordingly
Gradually introduce seedlings to outdoor conditions by hardening off for 1-2 weeks
Assess frost risk and delay planting if necessary until safe weather conditions are met
Wait for roots to establish before fertilizing to prevent nutrient burn
Avoid fertilizing immediately after transplanting as plants redirect energy to root development
Check for soil moisture in trays, especially in central cells prone to drying
Address any issues such as root entanglement or improper plant positioning during transplantation
Prepare to transplant remaining seedlings into trays as needed to prevent overcrowding
Document the process and share tips for viewers through the video's comment section and social media groups

tasks.task: Transplanting tomato seedlings into larger trays
